thread.title: High school football: Five things to watch
thread.title_full: High school football: Five things to watch - Times Union

author: James Allen
title: High school football: Five things to watch
text:
Photo: John Carl D'Annibale Image 1 of / 1 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 1 Green Tech's #35 Milton Lovelace catches a practice pass before the start of Saturday's game against Scotia at Bleecker Stadium Sept. 19, 2015 in Albany, NY. (John Carl D'Annibale / Times Union)
Buy this photo Photo: John Carl D'Annibale Green Tech's #35 Milton Lovelace catches a practice pass before the... High school football: Five things to watch 1 / 1 Back to Gallery 1 How the West was won: We will know Friday as the Class B West Division's two state-ranked squads collide when No. 11 Glens Falls (5-0, 3-0) travels to take on No. 5 Schuylerville (5-0, 4-0).
2 When La Salle moved into the Class AA ranks in 2002, it did not take long for a rivalry to develop with Columbia. The Cadets (2-3, 2-1) and Blue Devils (3-2, 2-1) meet Friday in East Greenbush with serious Liberty Division seeding implications at stake.
3 An intriguing Class C North Division encounter Friday pits surging Hoosick Falls (4-1, 3-1) at Corinth (3-2, 3-1).
4 Green Tech senior linebacker Milton Lovelace may be small for his position (5-foot-8, 170 pounds), but he's come up big all season for the Eagles (4-1 overall, 2-1 Northwest Division). Over the past four games, Lovelace registered 16, 14, 14 and 12 tackles, respectively. Green Tech plays Friday at South Glens Falls (2-3, 1-2).
More Information
Contact James Allen at 518-454- 5062 or email jallen @timesunion.com
5 A total of 77 undefeated teams remain in New York, 12 from Section II. We'll lose at least one (Glens Falls or Schuylerville) from those ranks.
